reviews.review_msg: Hasina is a very nice professor, however I don't think she taught very well, and the material seemed fairly easy for a 400 level course. There was a lot of group work and she marks really hard.

Hasina is an amazing professor! The class was not totally easy, but she is extremely approachable for help and gives really good feedback. A lot of memorization of the lecture slides and readings is needed for the exam, but overall the class was really enjoyable and I would definitely take a class with her again.

Worst prof at sfu. Although he has several degrees and designations, it's not clear when talking to him that he's an expert in his field. He is very difficult to understand, has group projects worth 50% of one's grade, and has an incredibly monotone voice. I will never take another class with him again.

Very similar to his HSCI481 class. Term group project with 2 parts (2 reports, 2 presentations). Difficulty of this class is not high but there are a lot of different components so it adds up to a fair amount of work. Stay caught up and you'll do well in the course. For the exams (he calls them quizzes), all the questions are provided in advance.

Horrible prof, yells at students and even made one of them cry. Doesnt follow the syllabus and makes up random criteria on the spot. His canvas is a mess and hes really rude and even made a student cry.. Gives nonsense assignments and taught us nothing. I learnt literally NOTHING from this class. NEVER TAKE IT WITH HIM

This prof was terribleAvoid at all costs. Changes rubricgrading scheming every single lecture Unclear about all assignments and exams Very biased towards students. every single class is group work- you are stuck with the same group the entire semester and if you complain about unfair grade he tells you to suck it up. nothing related to actualcourse

This course is difficult. There is a lot of work and it is challenging with time-consuming assignments (26 pages and then 18 pages), however Kiffer tried to do his best to help. He is SO nice and actually wants students to do well. This course is not an easy A-, even though the class average was an A-. He really made us work for our grades
Kiffer is amazing. I wish all professor at SFU were like him. HSCI432 was the best course i have ever taken. Highly recommend !

This class was one of the few epi courses at SFU that wasn't a waste of time. You actually do things like learn how to code in R and the only other major assignment was to write a fellowship proposal that you could use for a masters program! The R textbook that Dr. Card developed for the course was really helpful.
